'''Chedwyn Michael Evans''' (born 28 December 1988) is a Welsh [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]], on loan from [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].
Born in [[Rhyl]], Evans was signed by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] from [[Chester City F.C.|Chester City]]'s youth set up in 2002 and he subsequently progressed through the ranks. Evans was loaned to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in 2007, where he scored 10 goals in 28 league appearances, before returning to his parent club. With first team opportunities at City limited he was subsequently sold to [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] for £3 million in 2009. After an unspectacular first two seasons at [[Bramall Lane]] he scored 35 goals during the [[2011–12 Sheffield United F.C. season|2011–12 season]]. He also represented Wales at [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales under-21]] and [[Wales national football team|senior]] level, scoring on his debut for the national side in 2008, and making a total of 13 appearances.
Evans was [[R v Evans|convicted of rape]] in April 2012 and spent two and a half years in prison. His conviction was quashed on 21 April 2016 by the [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales|Court of Appeal]], and a retrial was ordered. On 14 October 2016, he was found not guilty. Prior to the retrial, he joined [[Chesterfield F. C.|Chesterfield]].<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-37659009|title=Ched Evans: Footballer found not guilty of hotel rape|date=14 October 2016|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
==Club career==
===Manchester City=== Evans began his playing career in [[Rhyl]],<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> before spending two seasons in [[Chester City F.C.|Chester City]]'s youth set-up from where he moved to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2002 following the closure of Chester's youth team.<ref name="graduate">{{cite web|title=The Graduates No.25: Ched Evans|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/news/academy-news/2011/october/the-graduates-no25-ched-evans|publisher=mcfc.co.uk|accessdate=23 June 2012|date=25 October 2011}}</ref> During the 2006–07 season, Evans was a regular in the Academy and reserve teams and was also in the side that reached the final of the 2006 [[FA Youth Cup]], where [[Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academy#Academy|City]] lost to Liverpool.<ref name="youth cup">{{cite news|title=Threlfall sets Liverpool on way to youth glory|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/apr/14/newsstory.sport13|work=The Guardian|date=14 April 2006|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref> In May 2007, Evans signed his first professional contract with Manchester City.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/city-sign-up-six-992306 |title=City sign up six |work=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=17 May 2014 |date=17 May 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140517132412/http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/city-sign-up-six-992306 |archivedate=17 May 2014 |dead-url=yes }}</ref> [[File:Ched Evans 05-10-2008 1.jpg|thumb|150px|Evans warming up before a [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] game in 2008|alt=Ched Evans warming up before a match for Manchester City]]In September 2007 Evans came off the bench to make his senior debut in City's 1–0 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] victory against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/7008012.stm |title=Man City 1–0 Norwich |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 September 2007 |accessdate=19 July 2009}}</ref> With first choice opportunities at City limited Evans moved on loan to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in November of that year, agreeing a deal until 1 January 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/7107131.stm |title=Norwich recruit Man City striker |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 November 2008 |accessdate=19 July 2009}}</ref> He made his debut for Norwich the following week when he came on as a substitute in the 3–1 victory over [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]].<ref name="canaries debut">{{cite web|url=http://www.canaries.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10355~37907,00.html|title=Blackpool vs Norwich City|date=27 November 2007|publisher=canaries.co.uk|accessdate=22 June 2012}}{{dead link|date=October 2016}}</ref> His first goal for the club came two games later, and just two minutes into his first start in a 2–1 victory over [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] at the start of December.<ref name="debut norwich goal">{{cite web|url=http://www.edp24.co.uk/sport/norwich-city-fc/ched_hungry_for_more_goals_1_638493?ot=archant.PrintFriendlyPageLayout.ot|title=Ched hungry for more goals|work=Eastern Daily Press|date=6 December 2007|accessdate=22 June 2012}}</ref> Evans returned to Manchester City after his initial loan deal expired in January 2008, having made eight appearances and scored two goals.<ref name="200708 stats">{{Soccerbase season|47379|2007|name=Ched Evans|accessdate=22 June 2012}}</ref>
Initially, Norwich manager [[Glenn Roeder]]'s attempts to extend the loan were refused, however, on 10 January, the two clubs agreed a deal to allow Evans to return to Norwich on loan until 26 February, with Manchester City able to recall him after an initial period.<ref name="norwich loan 2">{{cite web|url=http://www.canaries.co.uk/page/NewsDetails/0,,10355~1210903,00.html|title=Ched Returns|publisher=canaries.co.uk|date=10 January 2008|accessdate=22 June 2012}}{{dead link|date=October 2016}}</ref> However, after talks between the two clubs at the end of January 2008, the deal was extended to allow Evans to stay with the [[Carrow Road]] club until the end of the [[Norwich City F.C. season 2007-08|season]].<ref name="extend canaries stay">{{cite web|url=http://www.canaries.co.uk/page/NewsDetails/0,,10355~1230173,00.html|title=Thank Evans!|publisher=canaries.co.uk|date=31 January 2008|accessdate=22 June 2012}}{{dead link|date=October 2016}}</ref> Then Manchester City manager [[Sven-Göran Eriksson]] stated he had no plans to sell Evans and that he would not be leaving the summer transfer window.<ref name="graduate" /> Evans played regularly for Norwich for the remainder of his loan spell and by the end of the season he had notched up 10 goals from 20 starts and eight substitute appearances.<ref name="200708 stats" />
Evans made his Premier League debut for Manchester City in the opening game of the following season on 18 August, against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. He was not chosen for the starting eleven but replaced [[Valeri Bojinov]], who suffered an injury during the pre-game warm-up.<ref name="premier debut">{{cite web|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/evans-surprised-man-city-debut-198401|title=Evans surprised by Man City debut|publisher=tribalfootball.com|date=19 August 2008|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref> Evans scored his first [[Premier League]] goal for Manchester City against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on 21 September, scoring the fifth goal as City went on to win 6–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7613925.stm |title=Man City 6–0 Portsmouth |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 September 2008 |accessdate=19 July 2009}}</ref> With City's acquisition of [[Craig Bellamy]] and later [[Emmanuel Adebayor]], [[Roque Santa Cruz]] and [[Carlos Tevez]], Evans opted to leave in 2009 in order to get more first team football.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: I just couldn't handle it at Man City|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/footballnation/football-news/2009/07/26/ched-evans-i-just-couldn-t-handle-it-at-man-city-91466-24240032/|publisher=South Wales Echo|date=26 July 2009|accessdate=26 July 2009}}</ref>
===Sheffield United=== Evans joined [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] for an initial fee of £3 million plus possible future add-ons on a three-year deal in July 2009,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~1732306,00.html |title=Blackwell completes triple deal |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=24 July 2009 |accessdate=24 July 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090726094125/http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10418~1732306%2C00.html |archivedate=26 July 2009 |df=dmy }}</ref> making his debut for United in the first game of the new season; a 0–0 draw with [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref name="blades debut">{{cite news|title = Boro 0 – 0 Sheff Utd| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8185178.stm| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 7 August 2009| accessdate =8 August 2009}}</ref> Having bagged a brace for the [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales U21]]s during the midweek fixtures he then scored his first goal in Blades colours on his home debut, a 2–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref name="blades first goal">{{cite news| title = Ched Evans almighty as Blades bury Watford| url = http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/football_league/article6797561.ece| publisher = TimesOnline| date = 15 August 2009| accessdate =16 August 2009}}</ref> Despite a promising start Evans struggled to maintain any real form and was often relegated to the role of substitute during his first season with the Blades, making 36 appearances but scoring only four goals.<ref name="200910 season">{{Soccerbase season|47379|2009|name=Ched Evans|accessdate=22 June 2012}}</ref> The following season Evans was a regular first team choice and his form and scoring rate began to improve, despite the club going through a season of turmoil and battling against relegation. He finished the campaign as [[2010–11 Sheffield United F.C. season|top scorer]] with nine goals in all competitions,<ref name="201011 season">{{Soccerbase season|47379|2010|name=Ched Evans|accessdate=22 June 2012}}</ref> but was unable to prevent the team dropping out of the division.<ref name="relegation">{{cite news|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/local/blades-relegated-tears-as-sheffield-united-drop-to-third-tier-of-football-1-3340607|title=Blades relegated: Tears as Sheffield United drop to third tier of football|work=Sheffield Star|date=2 May 2011|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref>
With the Blades now in [[Football League One|League One]] there was speculation that Evans would be sold to ease the club's wage bill but an injury picked up in the last days of the previous campaign meant he was unavailable until early September,<ref name="blades injury">{{cite web|title=Evans update |url=http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~2351738,00.html |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=6 May 2011 |accessdate=23 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110912091017/http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10418~2351738%2C00.html |archivedate=12 September 2011 |df=dmy }}</ref> preventing him from moving on to another club. Having returned from injury Evans hit a rich vein of form scoring regularly in both league and cup competitions as the Blades contested for promotion.<ref name="2012 season" /> On 28 March 2012 he scored a second-half hat trick within 15 minutes against [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] giving him his thirtieth goal of the season in a 4–1 win for Sheffield United at [[Bramall Lane]].<ref name=BladeVchesterfield>{{cite news|title=Blades V Chesterfield|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17455197|accessdate=28 March 2012|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 March 2012}}</ref> During this impressive third season, Evans drew attention from [[Football League Championship|Championship]] and [[Premier League]] clubs with his contract scheduled to expire in the summer. However, Blades manager [[Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1960)|Danny Wilson]] stated that Evans "[wasn't] even thinking about leaving Bramall Lane", adding "Of course we don't want to lose Ched."<ref name=OlympicChed /> Evans was named League One Player of the Month for March 2012, having scored 10 goals in 8 games.<ref name="marchplayerofmonth">{{cite news|title=Blades striker Ched Evans named Player of the Month|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/sport/sheffield-united/sheffield-united-blades-striker-ched-evans-named-player-of-the-month-1-4424219|accessdate=7 April 2012|work=The Sheffield Star|date=6 April 2012}}</ref> He was nominated for 'League One Player of the Season',<ref name="player of the season">{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/footballeagueawards/20120209/shortlists-2012_2293339_2604804 |title=Shortlists 2012 |publisher=The Football League |date=9 February 2012 |accessdate=23 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120626184328/http://www.football-league.co.uk/footballeagueawards/20120209/shortlists-2012_2293339_2604804 |archivedate=26 June 2012 |df=dmy }}</ref> and in April 2012 Evans was named in the League One [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name="pfa team">{{cite web|title=PFA decided against dropping Ched Evans from League One team of year|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/23/ched-evans-pfa-team-year|publisher=The Guardian|date=23 April 2012|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref> He ended the season with 35 goals in all competitions,<ref name="2012 season">{{Soccerbase season|47379|2011|name=Ched Evans|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref> but following his rape conviction Evans was released by United at the end of the season.<ref name="leave blades">{{cite web|url=http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10418~2792398,00.html |title=Trio offered new deals - 11 released |publisher=Sheffield United F.C. |date=30 May 2012 |accessdate=14 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120602094408/http://www.sufc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10418~2792398%2C00.html |archivedate= 2 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> <!--Events relating to contact with Evans by Sheffield United when he was in prison, his return to training and opposition to both of those are included in his conviction section. Only add to this section in the event that Evans returns to playing football for a club. Please see the "Attempts to find a new club" section of the talk page.-->
===Chesterfield=== On 20 June 2016, Evans signed his first contract since his release from prison and the quashing of his conviction, signing for one year at [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] in League One. He was signed by his former Sheffield United manager Wilson, and their first-team coach was his former Blades teammate [[Chris Morgan (footballer)|Chris Morgan]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Chesterfield sign striker despite upcoming rape retrial|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36575406|accessdate=20 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 June 2016}}</ref>
He scored on his debut for Chesterfield on 23 July, his first game in nearly four years, in a 3–0 pre-season friendly win over [[Ilkeston F.C.|Ilkeston]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36876515|title=Ched Evans: Chesterfield striker scores on return to football|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 July 2016|accessdate=24 July 2016}}</ref> He also scored, with a free-kick from {{convert|25|yds|metres|}}, on his return to professional football, in a 1–1 away draw with [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]], on 6 August 2016.<ref name="flreturn">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36930021 | title=Oxford United 1-1 Chesterfield | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=17 August 2016}}</ref> In his home debut for Chesterfield, on 13 August 2016 against [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]], Evans produced a match-winning performance, scoring Chesterfield's third goal and having a hand in the other two from [[Gary Liddle]] and [[Jay O'Shea]] as they won 3–1.<ref name="homecfcdebut">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994128 | title=Chesterfield 3-1 Swindon Town | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=17 August 2016}}</ref>
===Return to Sheffield United=== On 8 May 2017, Evans was signed by former club [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]], having had several talks with [[Chris Wilder]].<ref name="Return to Sheffield United">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39844981 |title=Ched Evans: Sheffield United re-sign striker from Chesterfield |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 May 2017 |accessdate=8 May 2017}}</ref>
===Fleetwood Town=== In July 2018, Evans signed a season-long loan deal with [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/25706/11443685/ched-evans-signs-for-joey-bartons-fleetwood#referrer=https://www.google.com&amp_tf=From%20%251%24s |title=Ched Evans signs for Joey Barton's Fleetwood|publisher=Sky Sports |date=20 July 2018 |accessdate=20 July 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Fleetwood on 11 August in 2-0 away win against [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]]. It was his first goal since 2016 when he was playing for Chesterfield. Following his debut goal, Evans left the pitch to a standing ovation from Fleetwood fans.<ref>[https://www.blackpoolgazette.co.uk/sport/football/fleetwood-town-fc/goals-galore-in-this-fleetwood-team-says-ched-evans-1-9299705]</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ramsey101.jpg|thumb|Evans (''furthest left'') lining up for [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales U21]] alongside [[Aaron Ramsey]] and [[Christian Ribeiro]]]]
===Wales U21s=== Evans gained his first [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales U21]] cap in 2007. He became a regular member of the squad and in November 2007 he scored a hat-trick against [[France national under-21 football team|France U21s]].<ref name="u21 debut">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_of_wales/7100787.stm |title=Wales U21 4–2 France U21 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 November 2007 |accessdate=19 July 2009}}</ref> In doing so he became only the fourth player to have scored a hat-trick for the under-21 side, along with [[John Hartson]], [[Craig Davies (footballer)|Craig Davies]] and [[Lee Jones (footballer born 1973)|Lee Jones]]. Evans scored a brace against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina U21s]] in October 2009,<ref name="wales brace">{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19764,11065_3118622,00.html |title=Evans brace downs Bosnia |publisher=skysports.com |date=10 October 2009 |accessdate=23 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100210130448/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0%2C19764%2C11065_3118622%2C00.html |archivedate=10 February 2010 |df=dmy }}</ref> taking his tally for the Welsh U21s to 13 goals in 12 games.<ref name="graduate" />
===Wales=== Evans made his senior debut for [[Wales national football team|Wales]] on 28 May 2008, scoring the winning goal (with a back heel) in a 1–0 away friendly victory against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]].<ref name="debut goal">{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1022586/Iceland-0-Wales-1-Toshacks-Welsh-youngsters-look-Evans-inspiration.html |title=Toshack's Welsh youngsters look to Evans for inspiration|publisher=dailymail.co.uk |date=28 May 2008 |accessdate=24 April 2011}}</ref> He made 13 appearances for Wales in total, scoring once.<ref name="internationals">{{cite web|title=Ched Evans|url=http://www.eu-football.info/_player.php?id=25400|publisher=European Football|accessdate=23 June 2012}}</ref>
===Team GB ambitions=== On 28 March 2012, [[Stuart Pearce]], the [[Great Britain Olympic football team]] manager, was present at the match against [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]], in which Evans scored a hat-trick, taking his season tally to 30, in a 4–1 win at [[Bramall Lane]]. Evans commented on the possibility of representing [[Great Britain at the 2012 Summer Olympics|Team GB]] at the [[London]] [[2012 Summer Olympics]]: "If I was asked then it's something I'd definitely look at doing. I don't know whether I even will be though... But if the chance was there then, like anyone else, I'd certainly have to think about it."<ref name=OlympicChed>{{cite news|title=Ched warms to Olympic invitation|url=http://www.sheffieldtelegraph.co.uk/news/ched-warms-to-olympic-invitation-1-4401173|accessdate=30 March 2012|newspaper=Sheffield Star|date=30 March 2012}}</ref>
==Personal life== Evans was born in [[Rhyl]], [[Clwyd]].<ref name="birth place" />
After signing for Sheffield United, Evans moved to [[Millhouse Green]], [[Penistone]], in the nearby [[Metropolitan Borough of Barnsley|Barnsley]] area.<ref name="Evans can visit parents for Christmas">{{cite news|title=Bail varied so Sheffield United's Ched Evans can visit parents for Christmas|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-north-east-wales-16256904|accessdate=20 December 2011|publisher=BBC News|date=20 December 2011}}</ref><ref name=CourtApril2012 /> After the death of former Wales boss and Sheffield United player, coach and manager [[Gary Speed]], Evans revealed a message under his shirt after scoring his first goal in the [[FA Cup]] win over [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]], which read "Rest in peace Speedo".<ref name="Evans's Gary Speed tribute">{{cite news|title=Ched Evans was 'man on a mission' to pay Gary Speed tribute|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16037310.stm|accessdate=20 December 2011|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 December 2011}}</ref>
Since 2009, Evans has been dating Natasha Massey. Massey's father, Karl, a businessman, funded a website, "Chedevans.com", which proclaimed Evans to be "wrongly convicted of rape on 20th April 2012".<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chedevans.com/ | title=The Ministry of Justice allow prisoners who maintain their innocence to use the internet through a third party to make serious representations about their innocence. | work=chedevans.com | accessdate=8 January 2015}}</ref> He also hired lawyers for an [[appeal]].<ref name=massey>{{cite news|last1=Dowder|first1=Jamie|title=Should convicted rapist Ched Evans be allowed to resume top-level football career?|url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/oct/12/ched-evans-rape-resume-football-career-sheffield-united|accessdate=29 November 2014|work=[[The Observer]]|date=12 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-30698382 | title=Ched Evans: Attorney general's office probe into website | publisher=BBC News | accessdate=8 January 2015}}</ref> Evans and Massey have a son, born in January 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Disgraced Sheffield United striker Ched Evans becomes a dad|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/disgraced-sheffield-united-striker-ched-evans-becomes-a-dad-1-7696156|accessdate=9 February 2016|work=The Star|date=26 January 2016}}</ref>
==Rape trial== {{main|R v Evans}} Evans and another footballer, [[Clayton McDonald]], were tried at the [[Crown Court]] at [[Caernarfon]] after being indicted of the rape of a 19-year-old woman, who was alleged to be too drunk to consent,<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans rape case: nine fined over naming of footballer's victim|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2012/nov/05/ched-evans-rape-naming-woman|accessdate=13 August 2014|work=The Guardian|date=5 November 2012}}</ref> at a hotel near Rhyl in May 2011. Evans was convicted on 20 April 2012 and was sentenced to five years' imprisonment. He was eligible for release on licence after serving half of that sentence.<ref name=CourtApril2012>{{cite news|title=Wales footballer Ched Evans raped drunk teen as friend filmed, court told |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2012/04/11/wales-and-sheffield-united-star-ched-evans-due-to-stand-trial-for-rape-today-91466-30736174/ |accessdate=11 April 2012 |publisher=walesonline.co.uk |date=11 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120414003612/http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2012/04/11/wales-and-sheffield-united-star-ched-evans-due-to-stand-trial-for-rape-today-91466-30736174/ |archivedate=14 April 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref name="sky conviction">{{cite news|title=Evans jailed for five years|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11683/7687738/Evans-jailed-for-five-years|accessdate=20 April 2012|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 April 2012}}</ref><ref name="yp conviction">{{cite news|title=Sheffield Utd star gets five years for raping hotel woman|url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/news/at-a-glance/main-section/breaking-sheffield-utd-star-ched-evans-gets-five-years-for-raping-hotel-woman-1-4467387|accessdate=20 April 2012|publisher=Yorkshire Post|date=20 April 2012}}</ref> During his imprisonment Evans worked as a painter and decorator in prison.<ref name=massey/> In August 2012, Evans was refused leave to appeal against the conviction by a single [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales]] judge<ref name="Guardian_2012-08-21">{{cite news|title=Ched Evans loses first stage of appeal against rape conviction|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2012/aug/21/ched-evans-loses-rape-appeal|publisher=The Guardian|date=21 August 2012|accessdate=29 August 2012}}</ref> and the full court upheld the decision in November.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans refused appeal against rape conviction|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-20219573|accessdate=7 November 2012|publisher=BBC News|date=6 November 2012}}</ref> Evans continued to maintain his innocence and in November 2013 recruited a new legal team to attempt to clear his name.<ref>{{cite news|title=Former Sheffield United footballer recruits new legal team|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/local/former-sheffield-united-footballer-recruits-new-legal-team-1-6239430|accessdate=28 November 2013|publisher=Sheffield Star|date=26 November 2013}}</ref>
After serving half of his prison sentence, Evans was eligible for release, and was released on licence on 17 October 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/local-news/ched-evans-jailed-five-years-2048419|title=Ched Evans jailed for five years after jury finds him guilty of rape|author=|work=walesonline}}</ref><ref name=out>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/crime/11168642/Ched-Evans-leaves-prison-in-early-morning-release.html|title=Ched Evans 'leaves prison in early-morning release'|date=17 October 2014|work=Telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=17 October 2014}}</ref> Following his release, the [[Criminal Cases Review Commission]] announced that they were reviewing his conviction.<ref name=ccrc>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Investigation into rape conviction fast-tracked|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29679563|accessdate=19 October 2014|publisher=BBC News|date=19 October 2014}}</ref> In January 2015, it was reported that Evans had submitted fresh evidence to the Criminal Cases Review Commission, to attempt to strengthen his case.<ref name="Guardian_2015-01-28">{{Cite news | title = Ched Evans submits 'fresh evidence' to try to get rape conviction overturned | newspaper = [[The Guardian]] | date = 28 January 2015 | accessdate = 28 January 2015 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/28/ched-evans-submits-fresh-evidence-rape-criminal-cases-review-commission | quote = The former Sheffield United striker.}}</ref> In October 2015, the Criminal Cases Review Commission, following a 10-month investigation, and relying on "new material which was not considered by the jury at trial", referred the case to the [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales|Court of Appeal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/JamieGrierson|title=Jamie Grierson (@JamieGrierson) - Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
On 22 March 2016, the case was heard by the Court of Appeal, which imposed a ban on reporting details of the legal argument.<ref name="Guardian_2016-03-22">{{Cite news | title = Ched Evans rape conviction appeal is heard by judges | last = Grierson | first = Jamie | newspaper = [[The Guardian]] | date = 22 March 2016 | accessdate = 27 March 2016 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/mar/22/ched-evans-conviction-appeal-is-heard-by-judges }}</ref> On 21 April 2016, the appeal was allowed and the conviction quashed. A retrial was ordered.<ref name=Hallett>{{cite web|url=https://www.judiciary.gov.uk/judgments/r-v-chedwyn-evans/|title=R v Chedwyn Evans|publisher=Courts and Tribunal Judiciary|date=21 April 2016|accessdate=21 April 2016}}</ref> This began on 4 October 2016 and on 14 October Evans was found not guilty.<ref name="autogenerated1"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/1702958/footballer-ched-evans-pleads-not-guilty-to-rape|title=Footballer Ched Evans Pleads Not Guilty To Rape|publisher=|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
==Attempts to find a new club prior to his acquittal== {{Undue weight section|date=June 2018}} ===Sheffield United=== In April 2014, Sheffield United Co-Chairman [[Kevin McCabe (businessman)|Kevin McCabe]] and new manager [[Nigel Clough]] met with Evans in [[HM Prison Wymott]] to discuss the possibility of Sheffield United re-signing Evans after his release from prison.<ref>{{cite news |last=Higgens |first=Dave |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/ched-evans-sheffield-united-striker-to-return-to-club-after-rape-sentence-despite-petition-garnering-60000-signatures-against-him-9666380.html |title=Sheffield United striker 'to return' to club after rape sentence, despite petition garnering 60,000 signatures against him |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014 |work=The Independent}}</ref> Following speculation that Evans could rejoin his former club, a petition was signed by 150,000 people urging the club not to do so, which stated that it would be a "deep insult to the woman who was raped and to all women like her who have suffered at the hands of a rapist".<ref name=ccrc/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29541498|title=Ched Evans: PFA chief Gordon Taylor backs player's return|work=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=McCarthy |first=Mike |url=http://news.sky.com/story/1317716/petition-to-stop-ched-evans-sheffield-return |title=Petition To Stop Ched Evans' Sheffield Return |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014 |publisher=Sky News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Pidd |first=Helen |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/13/sheffield-united-ched-evans-rape-re-sign-prison |title=Sheffield United urged not to re-sign rapist Ched Evans |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014 |work=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-28769026 |title=Ched Evans petition: Sheffield United urged not to re-employ rape footballer |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=13 August 2014 |publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Percy |first=John |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/sheffield-united/11032474/Sheffield-United-face-opposition-to-plans-to-re-sign-former-striker-Ched-Evans.html |title=Sheffield United face opposition to plans to re-sign former striker Ched Evans|date=13 August 2014|accessdate=13 August 2014|work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/11167114/Ched-Evans-should-never-be-allowed-to-play-a-professional-football-match-again.html|title=Ched Evans should never be allowed to play a professional football match again|date=16 October 2014|work=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=16 October 2014}}</ref>
In November 2014, following his release from prison, it was announced that Evans would resume training with Sheffield United after the [[Professional Footballers' Association]] had requested that Sheffield United let Evans train at the club as they were his last club before his conviction.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Sheffield United allow training return at PFA request|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29980279|accessdate=11 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 November 2014}}</ref> The decision was controversial, and caused television presenter [[Charlie Webster]], businesswoman Lindsay Graham and musicians [[Dave Berry (musician)|Dave Berry]] and [[Paul Heaton]] to resign as patrons of the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Charlie Webster resigns as Sheffield United patron|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-30015701|accessdate=12 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=12 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Evans|first1=Alex|title=Another Sheffield United patron, Lindsay Graham, quits in row over Ched Evans training with club|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/another-sheffield-united-patron-lindsay-graham-quits-in-row-over-ched-evans-training-with-club-1-6948513|accessdate=17 November 2014|work=[[The Star (Sheffield)]]|date=12 November 2014}}</ref><ref name="Dave Berry">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-30028738 | title=Ched Evans row: Sheffield United patron Dave Berry resigns | publisher=BBC News | date=12 November 2014 | accessdate=13 November 2014}}</ref><ref name="Heaton">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-30087979 | title=Sheffield United patron Paul Heaton resigns over Ched Evans rape row | publisher=BBC News | date=17 November 2014 | accessdate=17 November 2014}}</ref> Athlete [[Jessica Ennis-Hill]] stated that she would want her name removed from a [[Bramall Lane#Jessica Ennis stand|stand at Bramall Lane]] if Evans was signed by the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Jessica Ennis-Hill makes Sheffield United warning|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30046618|accessdate=14 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=13 November 2014}}</ref>
[[The Football League]] stated that although they recognised the gravity of Evans' crime, they valued the reintegration of reformed criminals and could not take any action against any club which would hire Evans.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Football League would have to 'accept' signing|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30014184|accessdate=12 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=12 November 2014}}</ref> Sheffield United manager [[Nigel Clough]] said on 12 November that the club were "no where near" signing Evans, citing his 30 months out of the professional game and an important run of fixtures as reasons why a decision would not be taken immediately.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans 'nowhere near' Sheffield United contract|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30023525|accessdate=12 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=12 November 2014}}</ref> DBL Logistics, Sheffield United's sponsor on the back of their shirts, stated that they would end their sponsorship if Evans was signed by the club. John Holland Sales, who sponsor on the front of the shirts, declared that they would "re-evaluate" their relation to the club if he were signed.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Sheffield United shirt sponsor in quit threat|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30023525|accessdate=12 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=12 November 2014}}</ref> On 20 November, Sheffield United withdrew their offer to allow Evans to use their training facilities.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30054475|title=Sheffield United will not let convicted rapist train|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 November 2014}}</ref> Co-chairman Jim Phipps, however, attributed the decision to "mob-like behaviour", stating his belief that Evans had a right to return to his career having served his sentence.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ched Evans: Sheff Utd's Phipps 'angry' over training U-turn|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30151774|accessdate=21 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=21 November 2014}}</ref>
===Hartlepool United=== In December 2014, [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] manager [[Ronnie Moore]] said that he would like Evans to join the club. The comment brought criticism from [[Hartlepool (UK Parliament constituency)|Hartlepool]]'s [[Member of Parliament (United Kingdom)|MP]], [[Iain Wright]], who described Evans as a "[[Outcast (person)|pariah]]".<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/20/ronnie-moore-admits-hartlepool-united-interest-in-signing-ched-evans | title=Ronnie Moore admits Hartlepool United interest in signing Ched Evans | work=The Guardian | date=20 December 2014 | accessdate=21 December 2014}}</ref> The club later followed up this headline with a statement saying that Hartlepool does not wish to sign Evans.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.hartlepoolunited.co.uk/news/article/hartlepool-united-statement-on-ched-evans-2157918.aspx | title=Club Statement | work=Hartlepool United Club Website | date=21 December 2014 | accessdate=21 December 2014}}</ref>
===Hibernians=== On 2 January 2015, [[Hibernians F.C.|Hibernians]] of the [[Maltese Premier League]], through their English vice-president [[Stephen Vaughan, Sr.|Stephen Vaughan]], announced that they had offered Evans a contract up to the end of the season.<ref name="Indie_20150102">{{cite news | title = Ched Evans has been offered a contract - in Malta | author = Tim Moynihan | work = [[The Independent]] | date = 2 January 2015 | accessdate = 3 January 2015 | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/ched-evans-offered-contract-with-maltas-hibernians-football-club-9955259.html }}</ref> The British [[Ministry of Justice (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Justice]] said that such a move would not be possible as Evans was a convicted sex offender on licence and, as such, barred from working abroad.<ref name=malta>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/03/malta-prime-minister-hibernians-ched-evans | title=Ministry of Justice steps in to prevent Ched Evans from playing abroad | work=The Guardian | agency=3 January 2015 | accessdate=3 January 2015}}</ref> Malta's Prime Minister, [[Joseph Muscat]], warned Hibernians that hiring Evans could affect the whole country's reputation, while Justice Minister [[Owen Bonnici]] stated that Evans had a right to return to his profession after being released from prison.<ref name=malta/>
===Oldham Athletic=== On 4 January 2015, it was reported that Evans had been in discussion with League One club [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] and was expected to sign for them in a deal which may be worth as little as £400 per week. The club's manager [[Lee Johnson (footballer)|Lee Johnson]] was reported to have expressed "grave reservations" about the signing, but was overruled by the club's owner [[Simon Corney]].<ref name="Independent_20150104">{{Cite news | title = Ched Evans to Oldham exclusive: League One Latics manager Lee Johnson against idea of signing Evans | author = Ian Herbert | work = [[The Independent]] | date = 4 January 2015 | accessdate = 4 January 2015 | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/ched-evans-to-oldham-exclusive-league-one-latics-manager-lee-johnson-against-idea-of-signing-evans-9956932.html }}</ref> A petition against the signing gathered 19,000 signatures within a few hours<ref name="BBC_Sport_2015-01-04">{{Cite news | title = BBC Sport - Ched Evans: Convicted rapist in talks with Oldham Athletic | last = Roan | first = Dan | work = BBC Sport | date = 4 January 2015 | accessdate = 4 January 2015 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30671692 | publisher = [[British Broadcasting Corporation]] }}</ref> and over 30,000 by the next day,<ref name="BBC-30678251">{{Cite news | title = Ched Evans: Oldham say talks still ongoing for possible deal | date = 5 January 2015 | accessdate = 6 January 2015 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30678251 | publisher = [[British Broadcasting Corporation]] }}</ref> while politicians such as Labour Party leader [[Ed Miliband]] voiced their opposition to the move.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ched Evans: 'I wouldn't take footballer on,' Miliband says|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-30680239|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref>
On 8 January 2015, Oldham Athletic ended their interest in signing Evans, citing that proceeding could have resulted in "significant financial pressure" and would have "continued to be a divisive influence", while condemning the "vile and abusive threats, some including death threats, which have been made to our fans, sponsors and staff".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ziegler|first1=Martyn|title=Ched Evans deal was axed after 'vile and abusive threats, including death threats', reveal Oldham|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/ched-evans-deal-was-axed-after-vile-and-abusive-threats-including-death-threats-reveal-oldham-9966042.html|work=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> [[BBC Sport]] reported that a named relative of a staff member was threatened with rape, and that one sponsor already having ended their association with Oldham in protest and another saying that it would follow suit if Evans signed. The petition against Evans signing had reached over 60,000 signatures.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30727729 | title=Ched Evans: Oldham abandon bid to sign convicted rapist | publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=8 January 2015}}</ref> Meanwhile, a total of ten other clubs (other than Oldham and Sheffield United) from League One and League Two told BBC Sport that they would not sign Evans.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ched Evans: League One and Two clubs snub convicted rapist|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30698618|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref>
Evans stated that he withdrew from the deal due to "mob rule", and that he was concerned the building of Oldham's new stand would be adversely affected by his signing.<ref name="evans on oldham move">{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9636596/convicted-rapist-ched-evans-blames-mob-rule-over-collapsed-move-to-oldham |title=Convicted rapist Ched Evans blames 'mob rule' over collapsed move to Oldham |publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 January 2015 |accessdate=8 January 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Gibson |first=Owen |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/08/ched-evans-apologises-rape-victim-oldham |title=Ched Evans issues apology but maintains innocence as Oldham deal collapses |date=8 January 2015 |accessdate=8 January 2015 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> He also apologised for any grievances he had caused due to his rape case, but maintained his innocence.<ref name="evans on oldham move"/> Journalist [[Henry Winter]], writing for ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', refuted Evans' claims, instead saying that "it was people's disgust that a convicted rapist felt he could swan back into a high-profile job after revealing no remorse for a crime that would preclude re-employment for many", while criticising Evans for making "his statement of contrition ... on the offensive, legally questionable website that continues to make life miserable for his victim".<ref>{{cite news |last=Winter |first=Henry |authorlink=Henry Winter |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/oldham-athletic/11334487/Ched-Evans-mob-rule-card-is-a-cheap-trick-by-an-unrepentant-rapist.html |title=Ched Evans' 'mob rule' card is a cheap trick by an unrepentant rapist |date=8 January 2015 |accessdate=8 January 2015 |work=The Telegraph}}</ref>
===Grimsby Town=== On 8 January 2015, it was announced by [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]] director [[John Fenty]] that a financial backer had offered the club to pay his full wages in order to bring Evans to the [[Conference Premier]] club. Having held a board meeting along with team manager [[Paul Hurst]] it was decided that the move would be of too high risk for the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/Ched-Evans-Financial-backer-offered-pay-convicted/story-25824500-detail/story.html |title=Ched Evans: Financial backer offered to pay convicted rapist's wages if Grimsby Town wanted to sign him |date=8 January 2015 |publisher= |accessdate=14 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150417210814/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/Ched-Evans-Financial-backer-offered-pay-convicted/story-25824500-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 April 2015 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/CHED-EVANS-Grimsby-Town-boss-Paul-Hurst-refuses/story-25826097-detail/story.html |title=CHED EVANS: Grimsby Town boss Paul Hurst refuses to be drawn into furore over convicted rapist |date=8 January 2015 |publisher= |accessdate=14 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150109161943/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/CHED-EVANS-Grimsby-Town-boss-Paul-Hurst-refuses/story-25826097-detail/story.html |archivedate=9 January 2015 |df=dmy }}</ref> Grimsby had previously employed [[Clayton McDonald]], the fellow footballer and friend of Evans who was acquitted in the same case, during the 2013–14 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/clayton-mcdonald-ched-evans-rape-7993571|title=Clayton McDonald: 'Ched Evans rape case has destroyed my career and life'|date=26 October 2014|publisher=|accessdate=14 October 2016}}</ref>
